title: BREAKING: PSP investigate fatal shooting
content:
GREENCASTLE - Pennsylvania State Police, Chambersburg, were investigating a fatal shooting in the 400 block of West Baltimore Street that happened at about 10 p.m. on New Year's Eve.
A dispatcher at the Chambersburg barracks said early Sunday morning that an active investigation was underway into the shooting, but details were not available as of 1 a.m.
The trooper said a preliminary report would probably be released sometime Sunday, possibly Sunday morning.
The Franklin County Breaking News website reported at about 10:20 p.m. Saturday that a 15-year-old boy had been shot. That website called the incident an accidental shooting.
According to dispatch records, at least two ambulances and two medic units were dispatched to the scene. About 20 minutes later a coroner was requested, according to the breaking news website.
Watch for additional details as they become available.
